sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question. Look at the pictures carefully!

questions.question_text: What is the value of the digit 3 in the number 35?
Which number comes next? 10, 20, 30, …
Which shape has 3 sides?

visual.description: Three shapes: a triangle, a square, and a circle

questions.question_text: What is 8 + 6?
Which number is smaller: 12 or 21?
What is 15 − 7?
What time is shown on the clock?
Which coin is worth the most?

visual.description: Four coins: penny (1¢), nickel (5¢), dime (10¢), quarter (25¢)

questions.question_text: What is the next even number after 16?
Which group has fewer objects?

visual.description: Two groups: Group A has 7 stars, Group B has 4 stars

questions.question_text: What number is 10 more than 25?
Which is a longer object: a pencil or a car?

visual.description: A small pencil and a large car shown side by side

questions.question_text: What is 5 + 9?
Which shape is a rectangle?

visual.description: Three shapes: a rectangle, a square, and a circle

questions.question_text: How many sides does a square have?

sections.instructions: Read each problem carefully. Solve the problem step by step. Write your answer in the box.

questions.question_text: Sarah has 5 red apples and 4 green apples. She eats 3. How many are left?
Tom has 6 toy cars. He gets 4 more, then gives 2 away. How many does he have now?
There are 8 ducks in the pond and 7 on the grass. If 5 fly away, how many ducks remain?
Anna baked 10 cookies. She ate 2 and gave 3 to her brother. How many are left?
Jason picked 12 flowers. He gave 4 to his mom and 3 to his teacher. How many does he have now?

sections.instructions: Read each problem carefully. You only need to answer ANY 3 of these 5 problems. Show your work and write your answer in the box.

questions.question_text: Lily has 7 stickers. Her friend gives her 5 more, then she buys 6 more. How many does she have now?
Ben read 4 books on Monday and 3 on Tuesday. Then he borrowed 5 more. How many books does he have to read?
A bakery made 15 cupcakes. They sold 6 in the morning and 4 in the afternoon. How many are left?
Mia saw 9 birds in the morning and 7 in the afternoon. Then 6 flew away. How many remain?
David had 20 marbles. He lost 5 and gave 3 to his brother. How many does he have now?

sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 5²?
Which number is a prime number?
Simplify: 3(x + 2)
What is the mean of the numbers: 4, 8, 6, 2, 10?
Solve: 2x – 3 = 7
Which expression is equivalent to: 4(2x – 1)?
What is the area of a triangle with base 10 cm and height 5 cm?
What is the value of |–8|?
Convert 0.75 to a fraction.
What is the solution to: 3y = 21?
Which point is located at (–3, 2) on the coordinate plane?
What is the median of: 5, 9, 1, 3, 7?
Evaluate: 12 ÷ (3 + 1)
What is the volume of a cube with edge length 4 cm?
If the probability of rain is 0.6, what is the probability it won't rain?
What is the slope of the line: y = 2x + 3?
Simplify: (2²)³
Which of the following is a rational number?
Solve for x: x/5 = 2
What is the value of π rounded to the nearest hundredth?

sections.instructions: Solve each problem. Show your work.

questions.question_text: Sarah bought 3 notebooks at $2.75 each and a folder for $1.60. How much did she spend in total?
A rectangular garden is 12 meters long and 5 meters wide. What is the area of the garden?
A car travels 180 miles in 3 hours. What is the car's average speed in miles per hour?
A recipe calls for 2 ½ cups of flour. If you want to make half the recipe, how much flour do you need?
Jake earns $12.50 per hour. If he works for 8 hours on Saturday and 4 hours on Sunday, how much does he earn in total?

sections.instructions: Solve any 3 of the following 5 multi-step problems. Show all work in the space provided. Calculators are allowed for this section. Each problem is worth 10 points.

questions.question_text: A recipe for 24 cookies requires 2 ½ cups of flour. How many cups of flour are needed to make 60 cookies? Then, if you only have 5 cups of flour, how many cookies can you make? Show your work.

A store is having a 25% off sale. If an item originally costs $56.00, what is the sale price? If there's an additional 8% sales tax on the sale price, what is the total cost of the item? Show your calculations.
A rectangular garden is 5 meters longer than it is wide. If the perimeter of the garden is 58 meters, find the length and width of the garden. Show your equations and solve step by step.

A student earns $12 per hour tutoring and $8 per hour walking dogs. Last week, she worked 15 total hours and earned $156. How many hours did she spend tutoring? Set up a system of equations and solve.
A cell phone company charges a $30 monthly fee plus $0.15 per text message. If a customer's bill was $54 in one month, how many text messages did they send? Write an equation and solve.

sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 3² + 4?
Which of the following is a rational number?
Solve: 5x – 3 = 17
What is the slope of a line that passes through (2, 3) and (4, 7)?
Simplify: (2x)(3x²)
What is the volume of a rectangular prism with sides 3 cm, 4 cm, and 5 cm?
Convert 0.75 to a fraction.
What is the solution to the inequality: x – 5 > 10?
Find the mean of these numbers: 4, 8, 6, 10.
What is the probability of rolling an even number on a standard die?
Which point lies on the line y = 2x + 1?
What is 25% of 200?
A triangle has angles 50° and 60°. What is the third angle?
What is the greatest common factor (GCF) of 12 and 18?
Which expression is equivalent to 4(x – 3)?
What is the median of: 3, 7, 9, 5, 11?
Solve for x: 3(x + 4) = 21
Which of the following is a linear equation?
What is the value of |–6|?

sections.instructions: Solve each problem. Show your work in the space provided.

questions.question_text: Maria bought 3 notebooks for $2.50 each and a folder for $1.75. How much did she spend in total?
A pizza was cut into 8 slices. Jake ate 3 slices and Tom ate 2. What fraction of the pizza is left?
A farmer has 48 apples. He puts them into baskets with 6 apples each. Then he gives away 2 baskets. How many apples does he have left?
A tank holds 36 gallons of water. If it is filled at a rate of 4 gallons per minute, how many minutes will it take to fill the tank halfway?
Jasmine ran 2.5 miles each day for 4 days. Then she ran an extra 1.5 miles on the 5th day. How many miles did she run in total?

sections.instructions: Choose any 3 of the 5 problems below to complete. Show all steps and explain your reasoning.

questions.question_text: A school cafeteria serves 120 students. If each table holds 8 students, how many tables are needed? Then, if 3 tables are removed, how many students won't have a seat?
A rectangular garden is 6 meters long and 4 meters wide. What is the area? If the gardener increases the width by 2 meters, what is the new area?
A store has a sale: Buy 2 shirts for $18.50 total. If Jacob buys 6 shirts and a pair of jeans for $24.75, what is the total cost?
A train travels at 60 miles per hour. How far will it travel in 3.5 hours? Then, how much farther will it go in another 2 hours?
Mia earns $12 per hour for tutoring. She worked 5 hours on Monday and 3 hours on Wednesday. Then she spent $20 on school supplies. How much money does she have left?

sections.instructions: Circle the best answer.

questions.question_text: Ratio of red to blue marbles is 3:5, what fraction is red?
Evaluate: -4 + 7 - 12
Area of rectangle is 48 sq units, width 6, what is the length?
3 notebooks cost $6; what is the cost of 5 notebooks?
Simplify: 3x + 4 - 2x + 7
Slope of line through (1,2) and (3,6)?
Solve for x: 2x - 3 = 7

Simplify: x³ × x²
Solve: 2(x + 3) = 14

What is √49?
Simplify: (3x)(4x)
Which graph represents a function?
If x = 2, what is x² + 3x?
Solve: 5x = 35

sections.section_title: Section II: Two-Step Word Problems (Calculator Allowed)
sections.instructions: Solve each problem and show all work.

questions.question_text: Brenda bought 3 notebooks for $2 each and a pen for $1.50. How much did she spend in total?
A baker uses 4 cups of flour per batch of cookies. How many cups are needed for 6 batches?
Samantha earned $120 babysitting. She bought a jacket for $35 and split the rest equally among 5 friends. How much did each friend get?
A phone plan has a $25 base fee plus $0.10 per minute. If the bill was $45, how many minutes did the customer use?
Jose has twice as many apples as Maria. Together they have 36 apples. How many does Jose have?

sections.instructions: Choose and complete ANY 3 of the 5 problems below. Show all work clearly.

questions.question_text: Solve for x: 3(x - 2) = 2(x + 4) - 5
Graph the equation y = -2x + 3; label the y-intercept and one additional point.
A rectangle has a perimeter of 30 units. One side is 3 units longer than the other. Find its dimensions.
A company charges a $50 setup fee plus $20 per hour of service. If the total cost was $170, how many hours were used?
Solve the system: x + y = 10 and x - y = 4

sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question_text: Which expression is equivalent to (x + 3)(x – 4)?
What is the solution to the equation 2x – 5 = 13?
Which of the following represents the slope-intercept form of a line with slope 3 and y-intercept –2?

A quadratic equation has roots x = –2 and x = 5. Which equation represents this?
Which inequality represents: 4 less than twice a number is greater than 10?
If f(x) = 2x² – 3x + 1, what is f(2)?

What is the domain of the function f(x) = √(x – 2)?
What is the value of x in the triangle if sin(x) = 0.5?
Factor the expression: x² – 9x + 20

Solve: |2x – 3| = 5
The solution to a system of equations is the point where the graphs:

Convert 30° to radians:
Which of the following best represents exponential growth?

The graph of y = –x² opens:
Which of the following represents a linear equation?

sections.instructions: Solve each word problem below. Show all steps and clearly label your final answer.

questions.question_text: A concert ticket costs $45. A group of friends bought 6 tickets and paid a total service fee of $18. What was the total cost for the group?
Maria bought 3 pens and 2 notebooks. Each pen cost $1.50 and the total cost was $9. How much did each notebook cost?

sections.instructions: Solve any 3 of the 5 problems below. Show all steps clearly. You may use a calculator for this section.

questions.question_text: A gym charges a monthly fee plus a one-time registration fee of $25. If a customer paid $115 after 3 months, what is the monthly fee?
A taxi service charges a base fare of $4 plus $2.25 per mile. If a ride costs $20.25, how many miles did the taxi travel?
Jason has 75 apples. He wants to place them into bags with 9 apples each and then give away 3 full bags. How many apples does he have left?
A company offers a job with a starting salary of $32,000 and a guaranteed annual increase of $2,000. What will the salary be after 10 years? What is the total amount earned over 10 years?
A rectangular garden is to be enclosed with 80 meters of fencing. The length is 5 meters more than twice the width. What are the dimensions of the garden? What is the area?

sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question_text: What is the solution to the equation 2(x – 3) = 4x + 1?
Which expression represents the factored form of x² – 5x + 6?
If f(x) = 2x² – 3x + 1, what is f(–1)?
What is the domain of the function f(x) = 1 / (x – 4)?
Solve: √(x + 5) = 4
Which inequality matches the graph of a line that passes through (0, 2) and slopes downward?
What is the solution to |2x – 3| = 7?
What is the sum of the roots of x² – 7x + 10 = 0?
Which function represents exponential growth?
If log₂x = 3, what is the value of x?
What is the solution to the system: x + y = 5 and x – y = 1?
Which equation represents a line parallel to y = 2x + 1?

What is the range of f(x) = x² – 4?
Simplify: (3x²)(2x³)
If sin θ = 1/2, what is the value of θ in degrees (0° ≤ θ ≤ 180°)?
What is the result of (x – 2)²?
Which point lies on the circle with equation (x – 3)² + (y + 2)² = 25?
What is the inverse of the function f(x) = 3x – 7?
Which of the following represents a quadratic function?

sections.instructions: Solve each of the following problems. Show your work clearly. Calculators are allowed.

questions.question_text: A store sells pencils at 3 for $1.50. If Maya buys 9 pencils and a notebook that costs $2.75, how much does she spend in total?
A car rental company charges a $25 flat fee plus $0.20 per mile. How much would it cost to drive 150 miles?
Sarah has $75. She spends $18 on a book and then splits the rest evenly among 3 friends. How much does each friend receive?
A rectangle has a width of 8 cm and its length is twice the width. What is the perimeter of the rectangle?
A cell phone plan charges $30 per month plus $0.10 per text. If a customer sends 120 texts in a month, what's the total bill?

sections.instructions: Solve any 3 of the following problems. Show all your steps. Calculators are allowed.

questions.question_text: A farmer has a rectangular plot of land. The length is 3 times the width. If the total area is 192 square meters, find the dimensions of the plot.
A school has 300 students. 40% are in Grade 11. Of those, 25% are in the honors program. How many Grade 11 students are in the honors program?
A car travels 60 miles in the first hour, then 45 miles in the second hour. If the average speed must be at least 55 mph over 3 hours, how fast must the car travel in the third hour?
A cylinder has a volume of 500π cm³. If the height is 10 cm, find the radius of the base.
A laptop originally priced at $1200 is on sale for 25% off. A sales tax of 8% is then applied. What is the final price after the discount and tax?

sections.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question_text: What is the derivative of f(x) = 3x² + 2x – 5?
Evaluate the limit: lim(x→0) (sin x)/x
Solve: log₂(8x) = 6
If f(x) = x² and g(x) = √x, find f(g(4))
What is the solution to the equation: 2x – 3 = 5x + 9?
Simplify: (x² – 4)/(x – 2)
What is the integral of f(x) = 4x?
Solve for x: x² – 4x – 5 = 0
What is the vertical asymptote of y = 1/(x – 3)?

Find the value of the determinant: |2 3| |1 4|

Solve for x: eˣ = 7
What is the mean of: 3, 7, 7, 10?

Find the slope of a line perpendicular to y = 3x + 2
What is the solution to the inequality: 3x – 4 > 8
Expand: (x + 2)(x – 3)
If sin θ = 0.6 and θ is in quadrant II, what is cos θ?
What is the solution to the absolute value equation |x – 2| = 5?

sections.instructions: Solve each problem. Show all your work clearly. Calculators are allowed.

questions.question_text: A student invests $2,000 in a savings account that earns 5% interest annually, compounded once per year. After 2 years, how much money will be in the account?
A train travels from City A to City B, a distance of 360 miles, at a constant speed. If the trip takes 4.5 hours, what is the average speed of the train?
Ella bought 3 notebooks for $2.75 each and 2 pens for $1.60 each. She paid with a $20 bill. How much change did she receive?
A triangle has an angle measuring 30° and an adjacent side of 10 cm. Use trigonometry to find the opposite side (to the nearest tenth).
A phone plan charges a flat rate of $40/month, plus $0.15 per minute for any usage over 200 minutes. If Jordan used 260 minutes, what is his total bill?

sections.instructions: Choose any 3 of the following 5 problems. Show all your steps and final answers clearly. Calculators are allowed.

questions.question_text: A rectangle has a length that is 4 meters more than twice its width. If the area of the rectangle is 96 square meters, find the dimensions.
A student has grades of 82, 90, 87, and 88 on four exams. What score must they earn on the fifth exam to have an average of at least 88?
A car depreciates in value by 15% each year. If its current value is $25,000, what will its value be after 3 years?
A cylinder has a volume of 500π cm³. If its height is 10 cm, find the radius of the base. Use the formula V = π r² h.
A company offers two job options: Job A: $45,000 per year, no bonuses. Job B: $40,000 per year + a bonus of $1,000 for each sale made. If an employee expects to make 7 sales, which job pays more?
